result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Beltran

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:25 PM Defendant Joshua Beltran in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Martha Hernandez in court for Defendant.
Advised of rights. Complaint received, waived reading. Court reviews charges and penalties with defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court goes off the record to allow time for defendant to complete a plea questionnaire.
Court recalls case at 4:04 PM. 
Deft. changed his mind and would like time to speak with an attorney.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

3:29 PM Defendant Joshua Beltran in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs a spanish interpreter, Court adjourns.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
